definition: to leave room to maneuver/to leave a margin for error
old variant of 留[liu2]
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
old variant of 留[liu2]
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
surname Yu
(archaic) I/me/variant of 餘|余[yu2], surplus
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Though you need to make room for failure, you shouldn't just fail.
sentences.chinese: 虽然你需要给失败留余地，但你不应该只是失败。

sentences.english: There is no any room for argument on that point.
sentences.chinese: 在争论这问题上不留余地。

sentences.english: The junta will leave no stones unturned to win the elections.
sentences.chinese: 军政府将不留余地务必努力赢得选举。

sentences.english: You did not keep the leeway to forget me.
sentences.chinese: 你就不留余地地忘掉我。

sentences.english: No, the boss shot me down in the interview.
sentences.chinese: 没有，那老板在面试时不留余地数落我。

sentences.english: B:No, the boss shot me down in the interview.
sentences.chinese: 没有，那老板在面试的时候不留余地数落我。

sentences.english: God made relatives; Thank God we can choose our friends.
sentences.chinese: 神决定谁亲戚，幸运选择朋友方面给留余地。

sentences.english: If had the day I to die, you did not keep the leeway to forget me.
sentences.chinese: 如果有天我死了，你就不留余地地忘掉我。

definition: to leave some leeway/to allow for the unpredictable
to leave oneself a way out
to go to extremes/to leave no room for maneuver
feelings and sensibilities/sentiment and face/sensitivity to other's feelings
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to relent (to spare sb's feelings)/to show mercy or forgiveness/to forbear/lenient
to make a decision when it's time to decide
margin/leeway
propriety in speech
to hold back a trick/not to divulge all one's trade secrets
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
where it is possible to let people off, one should spare them (idiom); anyone can make mistakes, forgive them when possible
pinyin: de2 rao2 ren2 chu4 qie3 rao2 ren2

definition: to handle affairs/to deal with
propriety/appropriate behavior/proper speech or action/within the norms
leeway/latitude/room for freedom of action
